verses.verse: The burden <S%H4853><s%> of the wilderness <S%H4057><s%> of the sea. <S%H3220><s%> As whirlwinds <S%H5492><s%> in the South <S%H5045><s%> sweep <S%H2498><s%> through, <S%H935><s%> it comes from the wilderness, <S%H4057><s%> from an awesome <S%H3372><s%> land. <S%H776><s%>

A grievous <S%H7186><s%> vision <S%H2380><s%> is declared <S%H5046><s%> to me. <S%H898><s%> The treacherous man deals treacherously, <S%H898><s%> and the destroyer <S%H7703><s%> destroys. <S%H7703><s%> Go up, <S%H5927><s%> Elam; <S%H5867><s%> attack! <S%H6696><s%> I have stopped <S%H7673><s%> all of Media <S%H4074><s%>'s sighing. <S%H585><s%>

Therefore my thighs <S%H4975><s%> are filled <S%H4390><s%> with anguish. <S%H2479><s%> Pains <S%H2479><s%> have taken hold <S%H270><s%> on me, <S%H6735><s%> like the pains of a woman in labor. <S%H3205><s%> I am in so much pain <S%H5753><s%> that I can't <S%H8085><s%> hear. I so am dismayed <S%H926><s%> that I can't <S%H7200><s%> see.

My heart <S%H3824><s%> flutters. <S%H8582><s%> Horror <S%H6427><s%> has frightened <S%H1204><s%> me. <S%H5399><s%> The twilight that I desired <S%H2837><s%> has been turned <S%H7760><s%> into trembling for me. <S%H2731><s%>

They prepare <S%H6186><s%> the table. <S%H7979><s%> They set <S%H6186><s%> the watch. <S%H6822><s%> They eat. <S%H398><s%> They drink. <S%H8354><s%> Rise <S%H6965><s%> up, <S%H8269><s%> you princes, oil <S%H4886><s%> the shield! <S%H4043><s%>
For the Lord <S%H136><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to me, <S%H3212><s%> "Go, set <S%H5975><s%> a watchman. <S%H6822><s%> Let him declare <S%H5046><s%> what he sees. <S%H7200><s%>

When he sees <S%H7200><s%> a troop, <S%H7393><s%> horsemen <S%H6571><s%> in pairs, <S%H6776><s%> a troop <S%H7393><s%> of donkeys, <S%H2543><s%> a troop <S%H7393><s%> of camels, <S%H1581><s%> he shall listen <S%H7181><s%> diligently <S%H7182><s%> with great <S%H7227><s%> attentiveness. <S%H7182><s%>"

He cried <S%H7121><s%> like a lion: <S%H738><s%> "Lord, <S%H136><s%> I stand <S%H5975><s%> continually <S%H8548><s%> on the watchtower <S%H4707><s%> in the daytime, <S%H3119><s%> and every night <S%H3915><s%> I stay <S%H5324><s%> at my post. <S%H4931><s%>

Behold, <S%H935><s%> here comes a troop <S%H7393><s%> of men, <S%H376><s%> horsemen <S%H6571><s%> in pairs. <S%H6776><s%>" He answered, <S%H6030><s%> "Fallen, <S%H5307><s%> fallen <S%H5307><s%> is Babylon; <S%H894><s%> and all the engraved images <S%H6456><s%> of her gods <S%H430><s%> are broken <S%H7665><s%> to the ground. <S%H776><s%>

You are my threshing, <S%H4098><s%> and the grain <S%H1121><s%> of my floor! <S%H1637><s%>" That which I have heard <S%H8085><s%> from Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> of Armies, <S%H6635><s%> the God <S%H430><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> I have declared to you. <S%H5046><s%>

The burden <S%H4853><s%> of Dumah. <S%H1746><s%> One calls <S%H7121><s%> to me out of Seir, <S%H8165><s%> "Watchman, <S%H8104><s%> what of the night? <S%H3915><s%> Watchman, <S%H8104><s%> what of the night? <S%H3915><s%>"

The watchman <S%H8104><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "The morning <S%H1242><s%> comes, <S%H857><s%> and also the night. <S%H3915><s%> If you will inquire, <S%H1158><s%> inquire. <S%H1158><s%> Come <S%H857><s%> back again. <S%H7725><s%>"
The burden <S%H4853><s%> on Arabia. <S%H6152><s%> In the forest <S%H3293><s%> in Arabia <S%H6152><s%> you will lodge, <S%H3885><s%> you caravans <S%H736><s%> of Dedanites. <S%H1720><s%>

They brought <S%H857><s%> water <S%H4325><s%> to him <S%H7125><s%> who was thirsty. <S%H6771><s%> The inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%> of Tema <S%H8485><s%> met <S%H6923><s%> the fugitives <S%H5074><s%> with their bread. <S%H3899><s%>

For they fled <S%H5074><s%> away from <S%H6440><s%> the swords, <S%H2719><s%> from <S%H6440><s%> the drawn <S%H5203><s%> sword, <S%H2719><s%> from <S%H6440><s%> the bent <S%H1869><s%> bow, <S%H7198><s%> and from <S%H6440><s%> the heat <S%H3514><s%> of battle. <S%H4421><s%>

For the Lord <S%H136><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to me, <S%H8141><s%> "Within a year, as a worker bound by contract <S%H7916><s%> would count <S%H8141><s%> it, <S%H3519><s%> all the glory of Kedar <S%H6938><s%> will fail, <S%H3615><s%>

and the residue <S%H7605><s%> of the number <S%H4557><s%> of the archers, <S%H7198><s%> the mighty men <S%H1368><s%> of the children <S%H1121><s%> of Kedar, <S%H6938><s%> will be few; <S%H4591><s%> for Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> the God <S%H430><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> has spoken it. <S%H1696><s%>"
